page.title: 02ADDIEWELL-HOW IT BEGAN
page.content: The village of{Addiewell}lies in the Breich Valley midway between West Calder and Blackburn. Although it is a depressed area today that has not always been the case,for in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries Addiewell was the centre of the world's oil industry thanks mainly to the efforts of{James "Paraffin" Young. In 1865 Young first produced oil from shale and set up his distillation plant at a 70 acre site in Addiewell where he employed over 2000 people producing paraffin,oil,wax,candles etc. Sadly after World War Two it became too expensive to produce oil from shale and the industry gradually died out leaving us only the great red shale bings to remind us today of Addiewell's former glory.
